name: df-tgrp
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(ctgrp, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpt(s1, cfv(clh, cv(s0)), cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cfv(cltrn, cv(s0)), cv(s1))), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), cmpo(s2, s3, cfv(cfv(cltrn, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cfv(cfv(cltrn, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), ccom(cv(s2), cv(s3))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ TGrp =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(LHyp ` s0)‚Ü¶ { <(Base ` ndx),((LTrn ` s0)` s1)>, <(+ ` ndx),(s2 ‚àà((LTrn ` s0)` s1), s3 ‚àà((LTrn ` s0)` s1)‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àò s3))> }))
comment: Define the class of all translation groups. ` k ` is normally a member of ` HL ` . Each base set is the set of all lattice translations with respect to a hyperplane ` w ` , and the operation is function composition. Similar to definition of G in [Crawley] p. 116, third paragraph (which defines this for geomodular lattices). (Contributed by NM, 5-Jun-2013.)
